title: Unpopular Opinion: CertainlyT has really revolutionized this game with his work
body:
For all the shit people give him, what he has done with his creations has done a lot of good for the game.  I've talked to some Rioters about this and they completely agree.  The first great example I can give is Thresh.  Look at every support before Thresh.  You should notice that all of those champions were either shield/heal bots or CC bots.  Thresh was the first support that brought something to the table that wasn't just generic shielding and healing or CCing the enemy team forever.  If Thresh had not been made, then Tahm Kench, Rakan, and Pyke, who are all super fun and popular (Tahm to a lesser extent), would most definitely not exist.  Thresh showed us and Riot that supports could do more than just sit back and spam shields/heals or go in and CC the enemy forever.  Remember that Thresh was released all the way back in Season 3.  To do something as crazy as that so early in League's life is absolutely amazing.  Look where we are now.  Supports went from ward bots who nobody ever wanted to play to fun and exciting champions that have access to so many cool items and things to do.  If you are a Tahm, Rakan, or Pyke main, then you have CertainlyT to thank for that.

Next up is Yasuo.  People can hate on Yasuo all they want, but he has inspired countless other designers to make champions with incredibly unique abilities that bring cool things to the table.  If we look back at release order we have Aatrox, follwed by Lucian, then Jinx, and then Yasuo.  In just a few champions we went from one of the absolute worst champions ever created to Yasuo.  Before Yasuo, most melee champions just had a generic dash with some other abilities that could really be on any other champion.  Take old Fiora for example.  Her Q gave her 2 dashes, her W let her dodge 1 auto attack, her E was just a generic Attack Speed buff, and her passive was just a lame ass heal that nobody ever noticed.  Her old ult was super lit, but that's all she really had.  Yasuo brought everything crazy to the table.  Tons of dashes, Windwall, a Q that did multiple different things, double crit chance, and an ultimate that was insanely fun to use and could synergize insanely well with team comps.  There is a clear difference between champions made before Yasuo and champions made after Yasuo.  Most champs before him didn't bring anything special to the table, but every single champion after has brought something out of left field to League.  If you enjoy playing champions like Azir, Ekko, Kled, Camille, and Kayn, then you have CertainlyT to thank for it.

Although completely and utterly failed, the Morde rework put non marksman bot laners on the radar for Riot.  Nobody really talked about bringing non marksman bot lane before this (mostly just nerf X ADC so a different one can take their place), but now look where we are.  We got things like Heimer and Darius bot and a ton of mages too.  It was a tricky thing to do and it took quite a while, but we are finally in a place where more than just ADCs can successfully go bot lane.  You have CertainlyT to thank for that.

Not to even mention the Warwick rework which is one of the best reworks of all time.  **I'm not gonna try to deny that he has made some pretty big mistakes with champion kits that he has worked with in his career**, but I can confirm that we would not have all of these amazing champions that we have today without him.  This dude was doing 2017 and 2018 stuff in 2013.

This probably isn't the best time to post this considering people are probably freaking out about how busted and cancer new Akali will be and what not, but I'm posting this anyway.

replies.body: He brought unique stuff, but for the sake of game balance and that in my book is a colossal mistake. His designs single handedly ruined league in my honest opinion, not just because they are extremely unfun to play against (my best friend quit after 6 months because he couldn't handle Yasuo as a champion in every single game),   but because almost all of his champions are impossible to ever balance properly.  I mean you can have "boring champions"  like Rammus, Mundo and shit   and have a somewhat balanced game with fun interactive gameplay, or you can have flashy cancers like Yasuo, Zoe, new Irelia   and have a terrible game that made a lot of people , myself included, quit after 7+ fucking years.  So yes he has revolutionized the game but at the cost of killing it, slowly but eventually.
I agree but don't pretend Mundo an Does rammus are fun or interactive.

They aren't ?    Rammus is rolling towards your ADC, you stand in front of them to protect them. That is interactive.  Mundo is healing like a madman, you buy grievous wounds and kite him around.   None of these apply to Yasuo whose only counterplay is  "CC him" which is a counterplay to anything in this game or  Zoe , if you try that Rammus strategy with Zoe (which is what you are supposed to do when her bubble is coming towards you) you just die instead of your ADC which means you did nothing.    They might not be fun to play compared to CT's champions (because they aren't so overpowered and overloaded that they make you feel like a god)   but they are fun to play against (if their numbers are balanced) and have loads of counterplay that don't require you having 68 targeted stuns in your team.

> They aren't ? Rammus is rolling towards your ADC, you stand in front of them to protect them. That is interactive.

This is literally the only thing you can do and that requires you to have a frontliner or support with you at all times to avoid his Q. And even then it isn't avoiding it, its letting someone else body block the shot. 

In reality what happens is Rammus clicks you to death or presses E and you cant do anything for **2.25** (max rank) seconds except damage yourself and put yourself in a worse position. 

> Mundo is healing like a madman, you buy grievous wounds and kite him around.

Buying an item isn't counterplay.

Grievous wounds is effective counter-itemization, but even then he is literally nothing but a ball of stats and a skill shot he can spam in close range for easy hits. 

His only counterplay is to CC him.

There's nothing wrong with being unique. 

There's a lot wrong with being overloaded. Yasuo, was and always has been, overloaded. Qualities of a mage, assassin, fighter, and tank if the player so wishes.

What's the difference between the guy who wrote the Alien, and the guy who wrote Event Horizon?

The guy who wrote the Alien had an actual idea, the other guy just wanted to be seen as cool and sophisticated.

CertainlyT is the latter type of the 2, his designs are ""unique"" for the sake of being ""unique"", and he doesn't give a rat's ass about everything else in the game as well as how their creations actually fit into the game. An utterly self-absorbed designer that focuses solely on selling their fame/brand, than actually creating a good product that everybody enjoys. And this is not even counting how most of his designs are either just a) re-iteration of/"""inspired by""" another EXISTING idea that's not his own **and/or** b) radicalised version of the idea up to 11 without any brake, almost no exception so far, so one has to wonder why it is "revolutionary" given it's 'derivative' as all hell. And that's why his design philosophy is a complete failure.

Fightng any of his characters requires a list of things to go right, while all his characters need to do is push their buttons at you. And to just make fighting them even more annoying, most of his characters have overloaded mobility.

All of his champions have windows of power and plenty of counterplay, as well as having limited, conditional mobility. He doesnt have any hyper mobile champions currently. No, dashing through targets isnt plenty of mobility. Riven, talon, gragas and nid are hyper mobile.

I'm sorry, are you trying to tell me that his champions like {{champion:429}} and {{champion:157}} are not hyper mobile? They can infinitely dash, while every other champion has a cooldown attached. Sure, it's conditional, but conditional unlimited is a helluva lot worse than people who have real cooldowns.

And WTF? Gragas is hyper mobile? Since when? Talon also is just as conditionally mobile as Yasuo or Kalista. I think I need to get the name of your dealer, you've clearly got some strong stuff.

Kalista requires an auto attack target to use her mobility, and Yasuo requires an enemy he hasnt recently dashed to. Neither fall under hyper mobility.

And until Talons rework, Gragas was the most mobile champion in the game. He is extremely mobile with E, remarkably. 

Talon is far less conditionally mobile. There is plenty of terrain in SR for him to use his mobility to cross large portions of the map extremely quickly. Yasuo cant get from mid to bot quickly. Neither can Kali.

They require more work to play against, but saying that you need a whole list of things to do to play against them is just wrong.  All of his champions have clear weaknesses that you can capitalize on.  It's not the fault of the designer that people don't want to learn or adapt to the game.  Just because you refuse to learn how to beat a champion, it doesn't make that champion broken or overloaded.  If you go into a game having that mentality, then you shouldn't be surprised when that champion beats you.  This goes for all champions and not just CertainlyT's.  Unfortunately, many players have this mentality which is why all you ever see are Yasuo/Zed nerf threads on the front page.

i mean there is no better person to design a fun sophisticated and overloaded thing than him... he would be absolutely brilliant IF he would STAY THE HELL AWAY from multiplayer game.

MULTIPLAYER games require there to be fun on BOTH sides.. the person playing AND the person facing...

CertainlyT CANNOT do the 2nd part. and needs to accept that and move on the games where his talent at creating fantastically Overpowered and unique kits can be met with praise for everyone involved.. and not utter horror because other people have to face what he just made.
